content: I think fact was renamed to docs#nat.factorial since then
and lean thinks fact is docs#fact, which confuses it
Okay gotcha. Can I say something like I can in python like "import docts#nat.factorial as fact"
Also, are there any currently updated tutorials for lean 3?

Everything linked to on https://leanprover-community.github.io/learn.html should be kept fairly up to date, we have tools to make sure those projects still work, its just harder to keep videos updated of course!
I think open nat (renaming factorial -> fact) will do what you want (untested), see https://leanprover.github.io/reference/other_commands.html#namespaces
Okay perfect! How do I mark this thread as resolved? Thank you all very much!

You'll have to import data.nat.factorial.basic too though.
To resolve there is a little tick next to the thread title
One last thing is that we now have nice notation for factorial, if you do open_locale nat after your imports Lean should interpret 7! as nat.factorial 7
Nathaniel Collins has marked this topic as resolved.
